treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Cynareae;genus Cirsium;species ochrocentrum;variety ochrocentrum;
treatment.description: Stems densely leafy, nodes crowded. Leaves: distal cauline bases often long-decurrent. Corollas white or pale lavender to purple. 2n = 32, 34.

habitat_info.text: short-grass prairies , desert grasslands , sagebrush steppes , pinyon-juniper , mesquite woodlands , often in disturbed areas ;

treatment.discussion: Variety ochrocentrum grows in the Great Plains from South Dakota to New Mexico and Texas. It has been introduced in California; perhaps the Utah and Arizona records are introductions as well.
